title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 16
author: Various
snippet: The woods around Closeburn Castle are indeed most beautiful; and thatwinding glen which leads to Gilchristland is romantic in no ordinarydegree.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 17
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: There were frequent visiters, in those days, at Closeburn Castle.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 17
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: Helen Palmer was originally from Cumberland; her parents were English, buther father had removed with Helen, an only daughter, whilst yet a child, tothe neighbourhood of Closeburn Castle, to a small village which still goesby the name of Croalchapel.

title: Our coaching trip,
author: Carnegie, Andrew
snippet: " Lady Stuart Monteith," was the repl}^ She was of the Monteiths of Closeburn Castle, as we learned from Mr. Murray, our landlord at Cumnock.
